repo.name: azuredatastudio
repo.description: Azure Data Studio is a data management and development tool with connectivity to popular cloud and on-premises databases. Azure Data Studio supports Windows, macOS, and Linux, with immediate capability to connect to Azure SQL and SQL Server. Browse the extension library for more database support options including MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB.

pull_request.title: [New Migration Experience] Bug fixes in Import Data Collection.
pull_request.body:
This includes some of the bug fixes -

1) Removed await for azure recommendation [Major Fix]

    Previously, the dialog was open till the time azure recommendation is not ready. Instead now we do not await and instead show card Loading till recommendation is calculated. 
    
    
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/azuredatastudio/assets/32814075/f1c7c39b-0aea-4470-a5af-f98848a8eb65)


2) Added missing notifcation message on successful Import data collection and recommendation based on it.
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/azuredatastudio/assets/32814075/bea574ed-b65b-495c-8f9a-edf6d8f5f979)

3) During last bug fix, stopDataCollection got enabled by mistake. So disabled it at the beginning of toolbar creation.
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/azuredatastudio/assets/32814075/8dd9e623-66df-4c4c-ac35-fde0258fd0ce)

issue.title: [New Migration Experience] Bug fixes in Import Data Collection.
issue.body:
This includes some of the bug fixes -

1) Removed await for azure recommendation [Major Fix]

    Previously, the dialog was open till the time azure recommendation is not ready. Instead now we do not await and instead show card Loading till recommendation is calculated. 
    
    
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/azuredatastudio/assets/32814075/f1c7c39b-0aea-4470-a5af-f98848a8eb65)


2) Added missing notifcation message on successful Import data collection and recommendation based on it.
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/azuredatastudio/assets/32814075/bea574ed-b65b-495c-8f9a-edf6d8f5f979)

3) During last bug fix, stopDataCollection got enabled by mistake. So disabled it at the beginning of toolbar creation.
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/azuredatastudio/assets/32814075/8dd9e623-66df-4c4c-ac35-fde0258fd0ce)

issue.title: SQL Assessment ext: When ordering the list of results, the details are no longer in sync

issue.title: Query Editor doesn't open
issue.body:
Type: Bug 1. Click Explorer on left side of Data Studio window 2. Select any existing query (mine are all .sql) by double clicking the file name 3. Notice issue: Query Editor does not open (nothing happens) 4. Try again by clicking "File" in upper left and select either "New Query" or "Open File..." 5. Notice issue: neither option will open a query editor (nothing happens) 6. Try again by right clicking query name in explorer tab and choosing "open to side" 7. Notice issue: split window will appear, but file will still not appear (Close editor to return to single window view.) 8. Try again by right clicking file name and choosing "Open with..." 9. Choose "Query Editor" 10. Notice issue: nothing will open 11. Try again by right clicking file name and choosing "Open with.." 12. Choose "Text Editor" 13. Yay! File will open. Issue: in text editor we cannot run the code to test along the way (Close tab) 15. Try again: Choose "Connections" on left side of data studio window 16. Choose desired database and click small plug icon next to data base to connect 17. Once connected, a window will pop up to show details of the database. 18. In this window, choose "New Query" 19. Yay! A query editor opened. This is the ONLY place that will open a Query Editor, however it is a new file, not the ones I would like to work on. Once I save this new query, it becomes unopenable and I must create another new query (using same method) to copy and paste code from the text editor to test it. Azure Data Studio version: azuredatastudio 1.45.0 (8eff468100f02157f2219335f7a566d14451ca49, 2023-07-24T18:22:12.106Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045 Restricted Mode: No Preview Features: Disabled Modes:
System Info |Item|Value| |---|---| |CPUs|Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-10510U CPU @ 1.80GHz (8 x 2304)| |GPU Status|2d_canvas: enabled
canvas_oop_rasterization: disabled_off
direct_rendering_display_compositor: disabled_off_ok
gpu_compositing: enabled
multiple_raster_threads: enabled_on
opengl: enabled_on
rasterization: enabled
raw_draw: disabled_off_ok
video_decode: enabled
video_encode: enabled
vulkan: disabled_off
webgl: enabled
webgl2: enabled
webgpu: enabled| |Load (avg)|undefined| |Memory (System)|7.82GB (1.10GB free)| |Process Argv|| |Screen Reader|no| |VM|0%|
Extensions: none

@cheenamalhotra, the issue is fixed!
Thank you.

pull_request.title: Bring back vscode-encrypt
pull_request.body:
Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/azuredatastudio/issues/24737

VS Code has gone through significant changes to move away from keytar and a customized encryption module (vscode-encrypt) in the past few releases. The changes aren't compatible, although VS Code did have a migration story where they migrated over secrets from the old store & format into the new storage & format. 

More details about this here : https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/193301

The specific part that's impacting us and caused the decryption issue is that we completed skipped over the migration of the storage format (how they're encrypted) by jumping from 1.79 to 1.82. Specifically this PR where the migration code was removed : https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/189252

Because of this when the secret storage tried to load the secrets it fetched them fine, but they were encrypted with the old vscode-encrypt library and so the new encryption library wasn't able to decrypt them.

The fix here is to temporarily bring this code back for this release, and then we should be fine to remove it in the next release. Assuming that everyone is fine with this plan then I'll create a tracking issue for the next milestone to ensure we get that done.

pull_request.title: Update distro - Remove SQL Migration builtin extension
pull_request.body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/Microsoft/azuredatastudio/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests.
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->

The AGC team decided they didn't want the migration extension for now because it doesn't work in a disconnected environment since it needs to install STS separately, they want to plan on adding it back at a later time.

To be merged after ADS-release PR is merged.

VS Code has gone through significant changes to move away from keytar and a customized encryption module (vscode-encrypt) in the past few releases. The changes aren't compatible, although VS Code did have a migration story where they migrated over secrets from the old store & format into the new storage & format. 

More details about this here : https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/193301

The specific part that's impacting us and caused the decryption issue is that we completed skipped over the migration of the storage format (how they're encrypted) by jumping from 1.79 to 1.82. Specifically this PR where the migration code was removed : https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/189252

Because of this when the secret storage tried to load the secrets it fetched them fine, but they were encrypted with the old vscode-encrypt library and so the new encryption library wasn't able to decrypt them.

The fix here is to temporarily bring this code back for this release, and then we should be fine to remove it in the next release. Assuming that everyone is fine with this plan then I'll create a tracking issue for the next milestone to ensure we get that done.
